events.originalText: Bad weather caused a Chilean Air Force aircraft to crash into the Pacific Ocean, killing all 21 people on board.
events.subtitle: Chilean Air Force
events.headline: Chilean Air Force aircraft crashes into Pacific Ocean, killing all 21 on board

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 7.7 Mw off the coast of Nicaragua became the first tsunami earthquake to be captured on modern broadband seismic networks.
events.subtitle: 1992 Nicaragua earthquake
events.headline: 7.7 magnitude earthquake off coast of Nicaragua triggers first tsunami earthquake captured on modern networks

events.originalText: Hurricane Elena, an unpredictable and damaging tropical cyclone that affected eastern and central portions of the United States Gulf Coast, made landfall near Biloxi, Mississippi, as a Category 3 major hurricane.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Elena
events.headline: Hurricane Elena makes landfall near Biloxi, Mississippi as Category 3 major hurricane

events.originalText: Paddy Roy Bates proclaimed HM Fort Roughs, a former World War II Maunsell Sea Fort in the North Sea off the coast of Suffolk, England, as an independent sovereign state: the Principality of Sealand (pictured).
events.subtitle: Paddy Roy Bates
events.headline: Paddy Roy Bates proclaims Principality of Sealand on former Maunsell Sea Fort

events.originalText: South Vietnamese president Ngô Đình Diệm began an official visit to Australia, the first by a foreign incumbent head of state to the country.
events.subtitle: South Vietnam
events.headline: South Vietnamese president Ngô Đình Diệm visits Australia

events.originalText: The interim government of India, headed by Jawaharlal Nehru, was formed to assist the transition of India from British rule to independence.
events.subtitle: Interim Government of India
events.headline: Interim government of India formed under Jawaharlal Nehru to assist transition to independence

events.originalText: On the deck of the U.S. Navy battleship Missouri in Tokyo Bay, representatives from the Empire of Japan and the Allied powers signed the Japanese Instrument of Surrender (pictured), formally ending World War II.
events.subtitle: United States Navy
events.headline: Japanese Instrument of Surrender signed on U.S. Navy battleship Missouri in Tokyo Bay

events.originalText: Kantō Massacre: Amid rumors that Koreans had been conducting acts of sabotage in the aftermath of the 1923 Great Kantō earthquake, lynch mobs of Japanese murdered thousands of ethnic minorities such as Koreans and Chinese over the course of several weeks.
events.subtitle: Kantō Massacre
events.headline: Kantō Massacre: Lynch mobs in Japan murder thousands of ethnic minorities

events.originalText: Arthur Rose Eldred became the first person to attain the rank of Eagle Scout in the Boy Scouts of America.
events.subtitle: Arthur Rose Eldred
events.headline: Arthur Rose Eldred becomes first Eagle Scout in Boy Scouts of America

events.originalText: U.S. vice president Theodore Roosevelt first publicly used the phrase "speak softly and carry a big stick" at the Minnesota State Fair, describing his philosophy of negotiating peacefully while simultaneously threatening to use military force.
events.subtitle: Theodore Roosevelt
events.headline: Theodore Roosevelt uses phrase 'speak softly and carry a big stick' at Minnesota State Fair

events.originalText: White miners in Rock Springs, Wyoming, attacked Chinese-American immigrants, killing at least 28 Chinese miners and causing approximately $150,000 in property damage.
events.subtitle: Rock Springs, Wyoming
events.headline: White miners in Rock Springs, Wyoming attack Chinese-American immigrants, killing at least 28

events.originalText: Franco-Prussian War: Prussian forces captured Napoleon III at the Battle of Sedan, which led to the collapse of the Second French Empire within days.
events.subtitle: Franco-Prussian War
events.headline: Prussian forces capture Napoleon III at Battle of Sedan, leading to collapse of Second French Empire

events.originalText: French Revolution: Due to an overwhelming fear that foreign armies would attack Paris and prisoners would revolt, revolutionaries began the summary execution of more than a thousand prisoners.
events.subtitle: French Revolution
events.headline: French Revolution: Revolutionaries execute over a thousand prisoners in fear of foreign attacks

events.originalText: The United States Department of the Treasury was founded following financial concerns in the new nation.
events.subtitle: United States Department of the Treasury
events.headline: United States Department of the Treasury founded to address financial concerns

events.originalText: A large fire began in London's Pudding Lane and burned for five days (depicted), destroying St Paul's Cathedral and the homes of 70,000 of the city's 80,000 inhabitants.
events.subtitle: Great Fire of London
events.headline: Large fire in London's Pudding Lane destroys St Paul's Cathedral and 70,000 homes
